chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Jensen

8:40 AM Defendant Shavon N Martin in court, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. SPD-Regional Attorney Manager Jeremy Perri appears via zoom. 

Counsel has not yet been appointed for the Defendant. 

Attorney Perri states that since last hearing PD's office has been making contacts with potential counsel, but has been unsuccessful thus far. 

Court makes inquiry to Mr. Perri re: internal PD appointment. 

Attorney Perri makes inquiry re: time limits. 

Court will lift toll on time limits as it relates to speedy trial demand. 

Atty Perri requests a status of counsel at the end of next week. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter dated 11/01/2022, filed by Atty Martin, re: status of counsel

9:41 AM Defendant Shavon N Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Shawn N Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jeremy Perri appears for the Public Defender's Office. 

Attorney Perri states that the PD's office has reached out to 62 attorneys to attempt to get counsel for the Defendant in time for the jury trial set for next week. 

Court will make a good cause finding to toll time limits re: speedy trial to allow the PD's office to re-appoint, and take off court trial set for 10/25/2022. Court will set a status hearing 

Court will allow new appointed counsel to appear by zoom for the next hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:32 AM Defendant Shavon N Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Shavon N Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense had previously filed a Motion to Withdraw as counsel on 09/29/2022.

Defense is requesting to withdraw following the Defendant's requests for new counsel to be appointed. State takes no position. 

Court grants Motion for withdrawal. PD to appoint new counsel. Jury trial dates remain as set.

filed by Atty Miller

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 09/30/2022 - Will address on 10/10/2022.**
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List
Made in court.

11:12 AM Defendant Shavon N Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Shavon N Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Court to address bail motion. 

Defense makes arguments in support of request to modify bond to $1,500.00 cash bond from $3,000 bond. 
State makes arguments in opposition to any request to modify bond. 

For reasons stated on the record, the Court will deny the motion to modify bail. 

Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND, requests a jury trial date, and requests a status in 30 days re: discovery. Court sets. Defense may write to court if discovery is received, then 09/29/2022 hearing can come off.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

4:00 PM Defendant Shavon N Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Shavon N Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has pre-trial offer and has most of the Discovery. State is requesting the balance of discovery. Defense is conducting further investigation. Defense requests a bail/bond hearing. Court sets.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Atty Miller.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shavon N Martin in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   
Court to Address:  Defendant's Request for Bail Modification.

State presented its bail arguments to the court.
Defense presented its bail arguments to the court (requesting a signature bond).
State objects to any bail modification.

Court Denies - Defense Motion for Bail Modification.


  Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:10 AM Defendant Shavon N Martin in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Miller previously filed a request to modify bail.  Court sets a bail/bond hearing before the Trial Court.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
